results.authors: By Patricia Laya and Andreina Itriago Acosta
results.headline: Why Venezuela’s 2024 Presidential Election Might Actually Matter
results.summary: There’s little to trust about Venezuelan elections, which is why the vote on July 28 has become an interesting one. Nicolás Maduro has had a firm grip on the country’s presidency since 2013, when he succeeded his late mentor and predecessor, Hugo Chávez. Of late, Maduro has purged his inner circle, somehow managed to stabilize a shaky Venezuelan economy, and now seems willing to take his chances with an open vote.

results.headline: China Steel Demand Plateaus at a Decent Level, Vale’s Boss Says
results.summary: Chinese steel demand “has definitely plateaued” due to property woes, though the Asian nation’s appetite for the material is still at a “decent level,” said the head of the world’s second-largest iron ore producer.

results.headline: What Was Macron Thinking? G-7 Leaders Lament His Risky Bet
results.summary: Emmanuel Macron isn’t one for keeping a low profile. Typically, at the Group of Seven meetings, he’s one of the loudest voices in the room. But right now, he’s looking more like a spent force.

results.summary: Brazil’s retail sales rose less than expected at the start of the second quarter, the latest sign that growth is cooling in Latin America’s largest economy.

results.headline: Peru to Cut Rates After Inflation Hits 2% Target: Decision Guide
